topic.title: Initial Impression
topic.body:
Ive played with dat:// and some block chain / torrenting decentralized networks. This by far impresses me the most. The way that zn works and the large community using this is amazing! I love it. Before I had always though that decentralized networks were a thing of the future but this has suspended my belief! It is here!

That being said I would like to ask you, the people of zn what your favorite sites / programs are. Im looking to get deeper into zn!

1560684873_1AqPs23HT3V8rwqey5F5bXsLMUZUm.body: Beaker Browser to me is super lame and boring! The dat:// protocol is well flushed out the problem is content and keeping the files alive! The way that zeronet automatically downloads and shares the files / websites with you is a pirates ideal concept. Torrenting is all fun and games until you have no peers and have to wait 1y+ to get a file or website.

> [caryoscelus](#comment_162_13oRBYqNeUr6Tvgt4KkAT9FT4XRiKFBjnE): Heh, that's about what i thought when i first heard of "beaker browser". But the dat protocol existed before beaker and i believe is still useable now without it. The idiotic marketing rules dictate to obscure such info from users though and only advertise "beaker browser"

I agree with this. That concept was inherently flawed

1560883011_1CKTRBy9N4RvE3FgeZJpQqFYtLHc3.body: It frustrates me some times how connected people are to their devices. Every day kids are on their phones drowning in drama or other issues. It reminds me of a episode of black mirror.
